action.action-desc: Mr. Kiley of California (for himself and Mr. Messmer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To ensure that the provision of portable benefits to an individual is not considered in determining whether such individual is an employee of a person.

subsection.text: In determining whether an individual is an employee of a person for the purposes of any Federal law, such a determination shall be made without considering whether such person provides to the individual a portable benefit.

paragraph.text: The term portable benefit means a work-related benefit that is provided to an individual for work performed for another person in a manner that allows the individual to maintain the benefits without regard to whether the individual continues to perform work for such person.

subparagraph.text: means benefits, including protections, of a type that are commonly provided to full-time employees, such as workers’ compensation, skills training, professional development, paid leave, disability coverage, health insurance coverage, retirement savings, income security, and short-term saving; and
includes contributions, financial or otherwise, to such benefits—

clause.text: made on behalf of an individual by a person in connection with work performed by the individual for the person;
made through a combination of subparagraphs (A) and (B).
